p: ZIKV vaccine development has been very challenging due to existing cross-reactive anti-DENV antibodies that augment viral infections [ 11]. There are multiple ZIKV candidate vaccines under development with several of them in phase 2 clinical trials [ 12, 13, 14]. There have also been efforts for developing effective therapies against ZIKV [ 15], and a number of antivirals have been identified in vitro, but their safety and efficacy in vivo remain to be determined and none have been licensed for the treatment of ZIKV infection [ 9].
